titles.title: National Ag Science Center Act of 2006
To authorize the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture to make grants to facilitate the establishment of the National Ag Science Center in Stanislaus County, California.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation, Credit, Rural Development, and Research.
Unfavorable Executive Comment Received from USDA.

committee.subcommittee: Conservation, Credit, Rural Development, and Research
committee.name: House Agriculture

bill.summary: 4/6/2006--Introduced. National Ag Science Center Act of 2006 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture to make grants to the Ag Science Center, Inc., in Stanislaus County, California, to cover a portion of the costs of establishing the National Ag Science Center. Limits the portion of such costs covered by grants made under this Act to 33% of the total costs to establish the Center.
